review: Fast performance. I mostly use these type of devices to access Youtube. I also use Google TV and Roku. The Fire Stick has superior performance above the Google TV and Roku when it comes to Youtube. It loads YT videos quickly and performance is very stable...virturally no buffering and clear automatic full screen. Very satisfied with performance of this device. Although...I experienced very poor performance with loading Amazon movies and with buffering of Amazon movies. Also had bad experience with Amazon movies on GTV but not Roku.

review: Love my Fire TV!  Have both the stick and the box.  Bought the box and wanted to see how the stick worked too, so bought it, it worked great - and now it's with my sister.  I've tried Netflix and others, but I just like how Amazon organizes things.  I can always find things to watch for free...and this is seriously making me think about cutting out cable.  I think this with something like Sling, maybe HBO to Go and a solid internet connection, and that could easily cut my cable bill 3/4s. (and you can access those others from the fire TV).The only negative -- and it's a nit really -- is that I wish there was a way to watch something like a series without having to access each episode as the prior one ends.  I wished it just loaded each episode after the prior one finishes until you tell it to stop.  Maybe it can be done and I just haven't figured out how to do it?
